sen.j: 大炊御門 経名（おおいのみかど つねな、文明 (日本)12年（1480年） - 天文 (元号)22年3月24日 (旧暦)（1553年5月6日））は、室町時代後期の公卿。
sen.e: Tsunena OINOMIKADO (1480-May 6, 1553) was Kugyo (the top court official) in the late Muromachi period.
Tsunena OINOMIKADO (1480-May 6, 1553) was Kugyo (top court official) during the late Muromachi period.
Tsunena OINOMIKADO (1480-May 16, 1553) was Kugyo (top court official) during the late Muromachi period.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に変更しました。

sen.j: 後土御門天皇（103代）・後柏原天皇（104代）・後奈良天皇（105代）の三帝にわたり仕え、官位は従一位右大臣に昇った。
sen.e: He served in the three generations of the Emperor Gotsuchimikado (the one-hundred and third), the Emperor Gokashiwabara (the one-hundred and fourth) and the Emperor Gonara (the one-hundred and fifth), and promoted up to Juichii (Junior First Rank), Udaijin (minister of the right).

He served the three generations of Emperor Gotsuchimikado (the 103rd), Emperor Gokashiwabara (the 104th) and Emperor Gonara (the 105th), and was promoted to Juichii (Junior 1st Rank), Udaijin (minister of the right).

He served the three generations of Emperor Gotsuchimikado (the 103rd), Emperor Gokashiwabara (the 104th) and Emperor Gonara (the 105th), and was promoted to Juichii (Junior 1st Rank), Udaijin (minister of the right).

sen.j: 父は右大臣大炊御門信量。
sen.e: His father was Udaijin Nobukazu OINOMIKADO.
His father was Udaijin Nobukazu OINOMIKADO.
His father was Udaijin Nobukazu OINOMIKADO.

sen.j: 母は大納言正親町持季の娘。
sen.e: His mother was the daughter of Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Mochisue OGIMACHI.
His mother was the daughter of Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Mochisue OGIMACHI.
His mother was the daughter of Dainagon (chief councilor of state) Mochisue OGIMACHI.
He ennobled in 1484.
He ennobled in 1484.
He ennobled in 1484.

sen.j: その後、左近衛少将・左近衛中将・権中納言を経て、永正7年（1510年）には権大納言となった。
sen.e: Later, he became Gon Dainagon (a provisional major councilor) in 1510 after experiencing Sakone no shosho (a minor captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Sakone no chujo (a middle captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state).
sen.cmt: 本来の原文は、「その後、近衛府・近衛府・中納言を経て」となっていましたが、一部意味不明だったためウェブで参照したところ「その後、左近衛少将・左近衛中将・権中納言を経て」となっていましたので、こちらで訳出しております。
sen.e: Later, he became Gon Dainagon (a provisional major councilor) in 1510 after experiencing Sakone no shosho (a minor captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Sakone no chujo (a middle captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state).

Later, he became Gon Dainagon (a provisional major councilor) in 1510 after experiencing Sakone no shosho (a minor captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Sakone no chujo (a middle captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) and Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state).

sen.j: この職にある際の永正8年（1511年）加賀国へ下向している。
sen.e: He went down to Kaga Province in 1511 while he held this office.
He went to Kaga Province in 1511 while he held this office.
He went to Kaga Province in 1511 while he held this office.

sen.j: おそらく他の公卿と同様に経済的理由によると思われる。
sen.e: This probably seemed to be for economic reasons like other Kugyo.
This seemed to be for economic reasons as in the case of other Kugyo.
This seemed to be for economic reasons as in the case of other Kugyo.
He came back to Kyoto in 1515.
He returned to Kyoto in 1515.
He returned to Kyoto in 1515.

sen.j: 右近衛大将に任じられて再び朝廷政務に復帰した。
sen.e: He was appointed to Ukone no daisho (major captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and returned to the government affairs for Imperial Court again.
sen.cmt: 本来の原文は、「近衛府に任じられて」でしたが、意味不明なためウェブを参照したところ「右近衛大将に任じられて」となっていましたので、こちらで訳出しております。
sen.e: He was appointed to Ukone no daisho (major captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and returned to the government affairs for Imperial Court again.
He was appointed to Ukone no daisho (major captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards) and returned to the government affairs for Imperial Court again.

sen.j: 永正15年（1518年）内大臣に任じられる。
sen.e: He was appointed to Naidaijin (minister) in 1518.
He was appointed to Naidaijin (minister) in 1518.
He was appointed to Naidaijin (minister of the center) in 1518.
sen.cmt: ministerの後にof the centerを補いました。

sen.j: さらに大永元年（1521年）には右大臣に昇格した。
sen.e: Besides, he promoted to Udaijin in 1521.
Besides, he promoted to Udaijin in 1521.
Besides, he promoted to Udaijin in 1521.

sen.j: 翌年に従一位を授与された。
sen.e: He was awarded Juichii the next year.
He was awarded Juichii the next year.
He was awarded Juichii the next year.

sen.j: 大永3年（1523年）に右大臣を辞する。
sen.e: He resigned Udaijin in 1523.
He resigned Udaijin in 1523.
He resigned Udaijin in 1523.

sen.j: 天文11年（1542年）出家し、自性院と号した。
sen.e: He entered into priesthood in 1542 and called himself Jisyoin.
sen.cmt: 「自性院」について読み未確認
sen.e: He entered into the priesthood in 1542 and called himself Jisyoin.
He entered into the priesthood in 1542 and called himself Jisyoin.

sen.j: 天文22年（1553年）に死去し、嗣子がいないために大炊御門家は一時断絶となる。
sen.e: He died in 1553 and the Oinomikado family temporarily broke because it did not have a heir.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He died in 1553 and the Oinomikado family temporarily broke down because it did not have an heir.
He died in 1553 and the Oinomikado family temporarily broke down because it did not have an heir.

sen.j: しかし、その後、中山孝親の子の大炊御門経頼が相続した。
sen.e: Later, however, Tsuneyori OINOMIKADO, the child of Takachika NAKAYAMA succeeded.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Later, however, Tsuneyori OINOMIKADO, the child of Takachika NAKAYAMA succeeded the family.
Later, however, Tsuneyori OINOMIKADO, the child of Takachika NAKAYAMA succeeded the family.
